content.description: Fun route. Start on a couple sharp crimps with your feet smearing.. Move left to a big crimp and a right hand side pull. Hit the big jug to your left... Either dyno or take one high step and a committing move to the top. Mantle on up there.
content.location: The problem is located on the same boulder as Aristotle's Arete just to the left.

content.description: Fun cruiser slab climb. Crux is the second move using underclings to establish high feet. After that use the crack/flake or stay on the slab and use the ledges to top out.
content.location: Left of Heady Games. Obvious jug sit start. To get down, walk straight, then loop back around.

content.description: Very fun and exciting warm up for the area. Crux is a third of the way up pulling the big lip to get on the slab. After that its just a easy high ball. A lil heady! *Note: Real low block seems a little hollow, so climb with caution.*
content.location: Located on the main wall at the Ballers Club Boulders. Sit start on the left side slab.

content.description: Start this gem by hugging the bottom on two small crimps and a heel hook around the right side. Make your way up the arête on slopers and heel hooks. Use your left foot to smear. Top out is a bit skinny and tricky. Good holds on each side. You can get down by walking left and going easily to the right.
content.protection: 2 pads and a spotter or two.
content.location: Aristotle's Arete is the awesome looking arête you can see from the road.
